I think that a mix would probably be a good idea.  Some base levels
for a 'classic' feel (after all, so much of gladiator to me is defined by
the small stories inside), and a few new levels to introduce something
'new.'

I find it ironic that this discussion came just after the discussion on
ways to make your team ultra powerful without using the cheats --
massive healing after self-inflicted injuries, blob breeding, etc.

Also, I'll point out that most of the programming the Gladiator team
is doing right now is not related to gladiator.  It's generally to pay
the bills, or, as many as you have heard, is for Blizzard software.
Production and development in gladiator has come to a halt (for the
time being) so we can't expect them to up and code something that
would manage this.  What we -could- propose is an honor system,
where the players are responsible for the legitimacy of their own
scores.  It's not like we're giving out cash prizes or anything, and it
just wouldn't be worth it to lie about your scores on something so
trivial.  It -is- a possibility, but not a huge concern if we decide to go
that route.

A council might be in order, where a few dedicated people get
together and chat on IRC or something and talk about exactly what
the tournament is going to be.  Five levels, three of which are from
the original game, two of which are original challengers?  A rule that
players can only use one character, period? (This would eliminate
thief/cleric combinations scarring themselves for experience.)  What
will the basic outline be?  Will there be a story?  What will the story
be?  Those kinds of questions could be answered by a number of
individuals.

-Chris
